intro: Stenosolen, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grass. It is a perennial grass species native to Australia, characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Stenosolen has small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in dense inflorescences. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
